lead_paragraph: Sean Casey, a three-time All-Star, planned to announce his retirement as a player Tuesday and that he would join the MLB Network, according to Tony Petitti, the network’s president. Casey played in the major leagues from 1997 to 2008, hitting .302 with 130 home runs and 735 runs batted in for Cleveland, Cincinnati, Pittsburgh, Detroit and Boston.
